[Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. Their lack of interest shows that anyone approaching has already been observed from above for some time. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean.  An open giant black iron gate, a giant green oak tree, a small blue pool, a thick oak grate over the pool, and a polished stone marker are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Trade Way.]

From the city gate to the west, Trade Way continues eastward towards the busy Merchant district, past Joyeusse's Shop. The air is thick with the scent of fresh flowers. Wagons filled with goods bound for sale trundle past, their drivers hopeful of the anticipated profits. Eager young warriors venture towards the west gate and the dangers beyond.  An open carved rosewood door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Jessia the Novice Secian, and Emberlyn the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Kiralyn east...

[Trade Way.]

Deep grey mists surround a strange pile of rubble that lies south of the road. Occasionally a priest clad in a simple grey robe will wander past the rubble and whisper a short prayer under his breath. The fence running around the rubble is well kept, but the gate which once allowed entrance to this Temple has been chained closed.  A grey iron chained gate, a pile of rubble, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Trade Way.]

The throngs of travelers thicken as one heads east along Trade Way. An Anthian plays softly on a strange looking stringed instrument, her melodic voice filling the air. Judging by her clothing, and the number of silvers at her feet, she makes a fine living practicing her craft.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

[Market Street.]

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake, Jessia the Novice Secian, and Emberlyn the Novice Secian.

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

[Bazaar Path.]

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. For a small price, a farmer can rent a booth and directly market his goods. Both some of the best and some of the worst deals can be made within this collection of stalls. The tall wall of Spur looms high to the east, and many of the guards take an early peek into the carts and the goods coming to market.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake, and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kiralyn north...

[Bazaar Path.]

Further passage along Bazaar Path is blocked occasionally by brawling peasants. Fights break out over who got here first, who gets to sell first, whose goods are better and who should just pack up and leave. When guards are forced to leave their posts to settle the arguments, all involved lose.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

[Bazaar Path.]

The muffled noises you hear drifting in from the west come out of the Bazaar itself, a veritable hive of activity day and night. An occasion exotic smell is carried by the breeze to tantalize the nose. A large etched window displays tastefully dressed mannequins of many races.  An open sturdy mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Lutias' Haberdashery.]

Children giggle buoyantly as they do small chores around the store for a few coins. The seamstress scolds them loudly before turning back to the tall man, smiling as she measures him for a new outfit. The room smells of fragrant pipe smoke wafting through a doorway leading to a backroom. A tall Human man, handsomely dressed in fine clothes, awaits you at the counter ready to fill the incoming orders. A shiny silver plaque hangs upon the wall above the counter.  An engraved silver plaque and an open sturdy mahogany door are here.

>[Lutias' Haberdashery.]

Children giggle buoyantly as they do small chores around the store for a few coins. The seamstress scolds them loudly before turning back to the tall man, smiling as she measures him for a new outfit. The room smells of fragrant pipe smoke wafting through a doorway leading to a backroom. A tall Human man, handsomely dressed in fine clothes, awaits you at the counter ready to fill the incoming orders. A shiny silver plaque hangs upon the wall above the counter.  An engraved silver plaque and an open sturdy mahogany door are here.

You follow Kiralyn through an open sturdy mahogany door...

[Bazaar Path.]

The muffled noises you hear drifting in from the west come out of the Bazaar itself, a veritable hive of activity day and night. An occasion exotic smell is carried by the breeze to tantalize the nose. A large etched window displays tastefully dressed mannequins of many races.  An open sturdy mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kiralyn south...

[Bazaar Path.]

Further passage along Bazaar Path is blocked occasionally by brawling peasants. Fights break out over who got here first, who gets to sell first, whose goods are better and who should just pack up and leave. When guards are forced to leave their posts to settle the arguments, all involved lose.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
l in clo
Inside the white silk cloak you see a white key, an ancient tarnished sapphire storm charm, a white key, an opal ring of Set, a heart-shaped black opal pendant, a large brilliant mossy opal, a mossy opal, a heart-shaped black opal pendant, an opal ring of Set, a lantern, a skull shaped candle, a large mossy opal, a heart-shaped black opal pendant, and a black winged bat shaped amulet.
>
You follow Kiralyn south...

[Bazaar Path.]

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. For a small price, a farmer can rent a booth and directly market his goods. Both some of the best and some of the worst deals can be made within this collection of stalls. The tall wall of Spur looms high to the east, and many of the guards take an early peek into the carts and the goods coming to market.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Kiralyn south...

[Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.

You follow Kiralyn west...

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Kiralyn west...

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Kiralyn south...

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Kiralyn south...

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Kiralyn through an archway...

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Market Circle.]

What was once the notorious Spurian gambling hall has been completely remodeled and changed! Banners, ribbons and fliers hang all over the entire front of this massive building now thriving with business. A giant sign in red hangs down above the infamous oaken doors that reads, "Symher's Emporium", below the store name in small print a notice has been tacked on that reads, "We bring the savings to you!".  A pair of beautiful handmade mahogany doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious exits: south* west* northwest*.
[Market Circle.]

What was once the notorious Spurian gambling hall has been completely remodeled and changed! Banners, ribbons and fliers hang all over the entire front of this massive building now thriving with business. A giant sign in red hangs down above the infamous oaken doors that reads, "Symher's Emporium", below the store name in small print a notice has been tacked on that reads, "We bring the savings to you!". Obvious exits: south* west* northwest*.
>
You follow Kiralyn through a pair of beautiful handmade mahogany doors...

[Entrance, Symher's Emporium.]

Brilliant streamers hang festooned in deep swaths of velvet and bright multicolored bolts of silk over pearly white walls. Two circular glass enclosures rise some eight spans toward the ceiling on either side of the grand doors. Gentle tinkling music plays in the background as, within the cases, stunning garments of all types are lifted softly into magickal animation. According to the smiling Human attendant, their lovely lilting dance is but one of the many wonders that can be found within this shopping complex. Bright gauzy sleeves shift and undulate in the area to the east.  A pair of beautiful handmade mahogany doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake (an eagle upon her left shoulder), and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious exits: north* east*.

[Hues For You.]

A matronly Flerian looks up from a boiling cauldron of crimson dye. Quickly setting aside a brilliant tunic to dry, she removes an apron spattered with vibrant splashes that span the spectrum. Her rainbow colored hair magickally shifts from hue to hue as she steps gracefully forward whisking a color palette from beneath the counter and awaits a selection with a slow wink.

This room is illuminated.

[The Hall of Fashion.]

This spacious section of the emporium is nearly filled to capacity as the audience stares in awe toward the catwalk that divides this area in two. Ravishing male and female models step onto the catwalk adorned in the finest religious robes, evening gowns, and other full bodied garments, welcomed by the appreciative applause of fashion connoisseurs representing all upscale publishing houses. A lithe Frontacian woman approaches and, with a bat of her deep blue eyes, offers a small card upon which to place an order from this season's collection.

>[Entrance, Symher's Emporium.]

Brilliant streamers hang festooned in deep swaths of velvet and bright multicolored bolts of silk over pearly white walls. Two circular glass enclosures rise some eight spans toward the ceiling on either side of the grand doors. Gentle tinkling music plays in the background as, within the cases, stunning garments of all types are lifted softly into magickal animation. According to the smiling Human attendant, their lovely lilting dance is but one of the many wonders that can be found within this shopping complex. Bright gauzy sleeves shift and undulate in the area to the east.  A pair of beautiful handmade mahogany doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* east*.
go door
>[Market Circle.]

What was once the notorious Spurian gambling hall has been completely remodeled and changed! Banners, ribbons and fliers hang all over the entire front of this massive building now thriving with business. A giant sign in red hangs down above the infamous oaken doors that reads, "Symher's Emporium", below the store name in small print a notice has been tacked on that reads, "We bring the savings to you!".  A pair of beautiful handmade mahogany doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: south* west* northwest*.
nw
>[Market Circle.]

Keeping watch in front of this establishment, a fully assembled set of shining plate armor stands before the door. An inlaid crest on the shield reads "Thick as a Brick." Just inside the door, a young apprentice sits in his regular spot, hummming a tune while polishing a pair of gauntlets.  An open shiny steel door is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st frog (wearing a small gold collar).
Obvious exits: southeast* southwest* west*.
sw
>[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st trader.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
go ar
>[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.

>[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

>[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

>[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
e

[Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.
[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st small dog.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.
go gate
>[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.
e
e
e
>[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st frontacian runemage.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st city guard mage and the 2nd city guard mage.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st thugian guard and the 2nd thugian guard.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, and a deep fluffy snow drift are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black kitten (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st battle cat (wearing a small gold collar).

Tchori's head suddenly begins glowing. He places a hand upon his chest. The glow travels down an arm to his hand. The glow quickly spreads over Tchori's entire body, then fades away.


Wintersbreeze bows to Tchori.

Wintersbreeze smiles.

Kirrah giggles.
' i shall return i hope

Glinka says in Secian, " i shall return i hope"
>
Lisssa, hissing beneath her breath, just went southeast.
nw
[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* west* northwest*.
nw
>[Low Street.]

A darkly clad hoodlum leans against a worn street sign. He eyes those who pass by very carefully and then makes a few gestures into the shadows. All who are forced to travel upon this road have learned to keep one hand on their coin purse, the other on their weapon, and their wits about them.  A faded wooden sign and a glowing street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast* northwest*.
nw
>[Low Street.]

Low Street is the thoroughfare that carries people to the northwestern portion of Spur. The traffic along this road leans towards those without any viable economic means. Women who look older then their years, crippled old men and darkly clad shadowy figures all move stoically towards their destination. Only the plodding of worn shoes breaks the dismal silence.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
nw
>[Low Street.]

A beggar lies in a large pile of trash snoring deeply. His clothing is torn, filthy dirty, and a strong smell of alcohol wafts off of him. Sniffing around in the garbage, a hound looks for any scrap that can be eaten. The pup nudges the beggar and begins to rummage through the trash that he is using for bedding.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st trader.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
nw
>[Low Street.]

Potholes and cracks in the road impede travel on this portion of Low Street. Maintenance is not considered a priority, due to the roads distance from the center of the city. Unimpeded by the poor condition of the street, several people gather around a nearby newsstand, reading the latest issue of the Spurian Free Press and discussing politics. Across the street from the newsstand a sign next to a weathered brown wooden door reads, "Spurian Free Press" in large, bold letters.   A street lantern, an open weathered brown wooden door, and a wooden newsstand are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st city guard archer and the 2nd city guard archer.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
go door
>[Spurian Free Press Office.]

A rusty printing press, held together mostly by chicken wire and a prayer, dominates the center of the room. To one side, an elegant stained glass light fixture hangs over a long table that serves as a shared workspace for many of the staff. A frazzled looking Usil elf huddles at one end of the table, peering through thick glasses at a piece of parchment. Scattered at his feet are several heavily marked and crumpled papers.   A rusty printing press, a long table, a beautiful framed painting, a glowing elegant stained glass light fixture, and an open weathered brown wooden door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go door

[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* southeast* south* west* northwest*.
e
>[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
n
>[Northern Avenue.]

Beds of wildflowers line the carefully placed cobblestones along this street. A pair of love birds, cooing in delight, sit upon a white marble bench. The giggles and laughs of a pair of trysting lovers echoes from the room in the Traveler's Hostel to the east. It is certain that Rinanni looks down upon this scene with delight.  A white marble bench and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* south*.
n
>[Northern Avenue.]

A peaceful bliss pervades the very core of this guilded path. Below a large oak tree a couple of Rinannian priestesses sing lightly in Secti. Several merchants pause to listen to the song. Even a few hardened warriors cannot help but smile at the sweet melody.  A large oak tree and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>[Northern Avenue.]

The distant glimmer from a temple made of white marble and pearl catches your eye. An intricate gilded iron gate and a small winding path are all that separate you from the dazzling temple of Rinanni. Majestic marble statues of doves in flight stand on either side of the gate. The gaze of their peaceful eyes seems to follow your every movement.  An open intricately gilded iron gate, a pair of pure white marble dove statues, a street lantern, and an open dragon-etched emerald door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
go door
go door
>[The Emerald Dragon.]

The main room of the shop is small with a homely feel to it. The walls are composed of smooth fine-grained wood painted a beautiful emerald color. There are two large emerald-tinted glass windows by the front door. The floor is covered with a magnificent mosaic of an emerald dragon in flight. At the back of the shop a small emerald-veined marble counter sits beneath a set of shelves. Each shelf is laden with several small bottles of scents and herbs. A flowing emerald curtain to the right of the counter leads to the kitchen where food and drinks are prepared. Couches and tables placed strategically around the shop allow weary adventurers to rest in peace.  Some bright emerald satin couches, some linen covered oak tables, a small oak sign, a small emerald product sign, a small emerald product sign, and an open dragon-etched emerald door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
>[Northern Avenue.]

The distant glimmer from a temple made of white marble and pearl catches your eye. An intricate gilded iron gate and a small winding path are all that separate you from the dazzling temple of Rinanni. Majestic marble statues of doves in flight stand on either side of the gate. The gaze of their peaceful eyes seems to follow your every movement.  An open intricately gilded iron gate, a pair of pure white marble dove statues, a street lantern, and an open dragon-etched emerald door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>[Northern Avenue.]

A large stone building rises just to the east of Northern Avenue. These barracks house those known as Dread Knights. It is not unusual to see patrols of this elite group heading down the street towards Town Square. One would hope their presence would allow everyone to live in peace. If only they would stop fingering their swords all the time, you might believe it yourself.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>[Northern Avenue.]

Northern Avenue ends at a gateway set within the massive city walls. On the other side of the gate are the Guild Halls. Those who pass through accept the bond of peace that the Guilds impose on all who desire their services. On either side of the gate guards stand at attention saluting all those who pass by.  An open iron gate, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south*.
go gate
>[Northern Avenue.]

The city walls tower high above you at the entrance to the guild district. On top of the wall, a very bored looking guard with a lazy eye watches those passing through the gate. The large guild buildings spread out around the district, bustling with the day-to-day activity of the city's guild groups.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.

>[Northern Avenue.]

The city walls tower high above you at the entrance to the guild district. On top of the wall, a very bored looking guard with a lazy eye watches those passing through the gate. The large guild buildings spread out around the district, bustling with the day-to-day activity of the city's guild groups.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.
n
>[Northern Avenue.]

The massive building of the Merchant's Guild looms over a vast part of the guild district. The activity at the main door of the guild is mind numbing as hundreds of citizens and merchants alike rush in and out of the guild to handle their business. While the governor has control over the city guard, many claim it is the Merchant's Guild that runs the city of Spur.  An open exquisite polished mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st guard.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>[Northern Avenue.]

To the south the road runs back into the center of the city, further to the north the city road continues on toward the other guilds. All the legal city guilds are represented within this city district except for the Forester's Guild. A sign stands beside the road to help direct lost would-be foresters to their guild hall.  A beautiful etched wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>
[Northern Avenue.]

Numerous citizens walk purposefully along the busy street. Fighters and mercenaries make up the majority, but some from almost all walks of life hurry past as well. A dejected street cleaner struggles to keep up with the messes left behind by the pets and other beasts that travel on the roads.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman and the 2nd townsman.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>[Crossing.]

Northern Avenue meets Art Avenue at this intersection. Further to the north, the Mercenary's Guild makes its home, while the Bard's and Sage's Guilds are to the east. The extravagant Merchant's Guild stands to the south. Various sponsors wave pieces of parchment in an attempt to recruit new members.  An open lustrous hammered steel door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman and the 2nd townsman.
Obvious paths: north* east* south*.

e
[Artist Avenue.]

Muscle-bound warriors pass scrawny sages on the street. War dogs growl and battle cats hiss. Wealthy merchants walk by gaunt beggars. A bard sings to no one in particular. It's just another day on the hectic streets of Spur.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
e
>[Artist Avenue.]

Massive warriors push past the smaller merchants, bards, performers and common citizens of the city along this section of Art Avenue. Before you stands the majestic and refined home of the Sage's Guild. To the west the road runs into Northern Avenue where the city's two largest guilds, the merchants and mercenaries, make their home. The Bards guild can be seen to the east.  An open ancient elm door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
go door
>[Sage's Guild.]

The head Usilin Librarian looks up at you aloofly from behind his desk as you enter, no doubt annoyed by the interruption of his cataloging. The stone tile on the ground, as well as the stone walls, makes the lobby seem isolated and remote. However, the many scribes hurrying about their business belays such an assumption. Students can be seen entering and exiting the Sagely Supplies store or listening to a lecture going on in the Debate Room to the east, while scholars can be seen heading for the quiet solace of the Library to the west.  A mahogany sign, an open ancient elm door, an open sun patterned rosewood door, and a spiraling staircase are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
w
>[Sage's Guild, Library.]

Polished maple bookcases line the sides of the wall, leaving only the occasional small space which is filled by windows. During the day, the windows provide light to those studying at the tables that sit in the middle of the Library. By night, they provide ample observation room for astronomers and astrologers alike, as well as the simply curious. A Usilian librarian can be seen filing away a book into one of the many bookcases within this five-story building.  A mahogany table and chairs, a rune carved mahogany bookcase, and a chiseled marble notice are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east*.
e

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
e
>[Sage's Guild, Debate Room.]

This is where members of all rank, race and profession come to settle their arguments and disputes in a civil manner. There is a stage with two podiums at either end for the opposing sides to make arguments. Another stands farther back and to the center.  A grey marble podium, a white granite podium, a black obsidian podium, and a polished sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west*.

>[Sage's Abode.]

Two bookcases dominate the room, filled with various books, tomes, and journals. Two slightly opened windows provide a comfortable breeze, while a fireplace in the corner provides a gentle light to the room, as well as it's pleasing heat. In front of the fireplace sits a small oval oak table, surrounded by several rainbow pillows. A sweet smell comes from a barrel in another corner of the room, filling the area, and forming a very comfortable atmosphere.  An oak table, a rainbow pillow, a rainbow pillow, a rainbow pillow, an open wooden barrel, a closed rainbow painted oak door, and a spiraling staircase are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Sagely Supplies.]

Highly polished rosewood shelves lined with tomes, books and codexes of every sort imaginable rest against the tiled walls. An old table near the back is haphazardly piled with seemingly forgotten alchemy apparatuses, torn scrolls and cracked inkwells. Several sages and apprentices appear to be taking notes from the scheduled guest lecturer in one far corner while others wander aimlessly through the store sifting through the assembled scrolls and tomes. A kindly old usil smiles from behind a counter, contentedly watching it all.  An open sun patterned rosewood door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Gock the Go-blin-al.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, and a deep fluffy snow drift are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Oake the Noble Secian, Railt the Noble Penthanian, Kirrah the Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Tchori the Leuian, and Equality the Noble Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
se
>[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.
go door
>[Bank.]

Two large Thugian guards stand sentinel on each side of the doors to the main branch of the Bank of Spur. Elegant furnishings adorn the office. Polished oak and gold filigree emphasize the wealth that abounds in this establishment. Well-dressed tellers stand ready to help you store your money safely or to reduce your coinage to more manageable form.  An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a wooden sign, and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.
w
[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
w
[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rinannian cleric.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st beggar.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.
go gate
>[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.
w
w
>[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
w
w

s
[Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st merchant.
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.
[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.
[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.
[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.

go ar
>[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake, and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Butcher Shop.]

The Butcher Shop supplies the local food outlets with beef and poultry. Maynard also caters directly to those Spurians with more exotic tastes, selling many interesting cuts and prepared items. An angry employee with a broom is constantly chasing away stray dogs looking for a handout.  An open heavy oak door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* east* southeast*.
se
>[Market Circle.]

Polished rosewood trim surrounds the door and windows of this tavern. A hand carved relief of intertwined roses adorns the front door, and the words "The Rose Eternal" stand out in gold leaf. Friendly chatter and spirited discussions in all languages can be heard from this famed establishment. Fine food and drink wait just inside.  An open finely carved rosewood door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast* east* northwest*.
go door
>[Rose Eternal Tavern]

Illumination from the dim oil lamps barely cuts through spilt drink and stale tobacco scented air.  A group of drag-als that seem to have become a permanent fixture here beckons you to join them for a pitcher of ale, and motions to the bartender indicating that you're paying.  Without bothering to acknowledge them, the bartender flashes a toothless grin toward a crowd more likely to have a few coins in their pockets, points them toward a table in the back and offers them an etched wood menu.  An open finely carved rosewood door, a small stage, some vomit, a broken glass bottle, a wooden chair, a wooden table leg, and a wooden chair are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Market Circle General Store.]

Razalthab's General Store is a necessary stop before setting out on any adventure. From torches and backpacks to food and drink, all the basics can be found. A young Leuian kneels by the door, rummaging through his backpack.  An open mahogany door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* west*.
go door
>[General Store.]

Almost any item imaginable can be seen on the walls or shelves of Market Circle's General Store.  Casks of water line one wall and assorted backpacks and pouches hang on pegs in the back.  A row of shiny new lanterns sit upon a battered wooden counter where an elderly human man stands waiting for your order.  An open mahogany door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Market Circle.]

What was once the notorious Spurian gambling hall has been completely remodeled and changed! Banners, ribbons and fliers hang all over the entire front of this massive building now thriving with business. A giant sign in red hangs down above the infamous oaken doors that reads, "Symher's Emporium", below the store name in small print a notice has been tacked on that reads, "We bring the savings to you!".  A pair of beautiful handmade mahogany doors are here.

>[Market Circle.]

By torchlight or daylight, the windows of this shop sparkle from the many faceted stones inside. The sight almost makes one forget the presence of two Thugian guards and their war dogs guarding the entrance. The etched window glass indicates this is Fredriquede Tiffany's place of business, widely regarded as the finest jeweler in the land.  An engraved marble plaque and an open banded steelwood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast* southeast* south*.
>[Fredriquede Tiffany's Fine Jewel and Gem Shoppe]

A flashy Drag-al merchant swaggers up to you, introduces himself as Fredriquede Tiffany, and starts loudly praising everything in his shop. You can hardly see his fingers for the oversized rings, and his heavy gold necklaces reveal a taste for the expensive more than the classy, but you have to grudgingly admit that he knows his gems.   An open banded steelwood door is here.

This room is illuminated.

[Side Street.]

A new building has been erected on this side street. It is sturdily constructed from wood and brick, and bears a sign reading, "Symher's Trading Post." Various objects line the window display ranging from weapons and armor to random objects you've never seen before. Insistent bartering goes on at all hours.  A pair of open double applewood doors and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east*.
[Spurian Trading Post.]

Symher the Usil Trader sits in a corner with a small lamp cataloging and appraising the various items he has deemed fit to buy.  The cluttered shelves are piled so high it's a wonder he can keep track.  You carefully make your way through the armor, weapons and assorted sundries, to the counter.  A pair of open double applewood doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[Market Circle.]

Just inside the door, a young apprentice sits in his regular spot, hummming a tune while polishing a pair of gauntlets.  An open shiny steel door is here.

[Thick as a Brick.]

Several wooden mannequins display different types of armor on the floor of Thick as a Brick.  Cheaper suits of mail and armor are towards the front, while the more expensive and more fragile sets are in the back where a keen-eyed Fir Elf keeps an eye on them.  An open shiny steel door is here.

>[Market Circle.]

Keeping watch in front of this establishment, a fully assembled set of shining plate armor stands before the door. An inlaid crest on the shield reads "Thick as a Brick." Just inside the door, a young apprentice sits in his regular spot, hummming a tune while polishing a pair of gauntlets.  An open shiny steel door is here.

>[Market Circle.]

Swords and Such stands beside the Market Circle arch. Based on the inventory seen through the windows and the size of the building, this shop could outfit a small army. A loud voice from inside rings out, as an exasperated Hithual tries to explain to an Oog-ra that daggers are not made for smashing things. After much frustration, the Hithual relents, and sells the giant his new "basher."  An open russet oak door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* south* southwest*.
go door
>[Swords and Such.]

Many weapons hang on the walls of Swords and Such.  Swords and axes hang on the back wall, while clubs, hammers, and other blunt weapons are to your left, and various pole weapons are to the right.  A few of the smaller and more expensive weapons are in a small glass display case next to the main counter.  Two massive war hammers are crossed above the main entrance as a symbol of luck.  An open russet oak door is here.

>[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

>[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

>[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Trade Way & Bazaar Path.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.
[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.
go gate
>[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.

e
e
>[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rinannian cleric.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, and a deep fluffy snow drift are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Stanrar the Noble Human, Oake the Noble Secian (lying down), Zackie the Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Tchori the Leuian, Cappy the Noble Secian, Saek the Noble Drake (flying 15 feet above ground), and Kagee the Noble San Elf.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern and some charred foliage are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Saek the Noble Drake (flying 15 feet above ground).

[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Emberlyn the Novice Secian, Kiralyn the Secian, Caylith the Drake, and Jessia the Novice Secian.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention. [Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  A closed elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Intersection.]

[Noble Way.]

The entire avenue is composed of fine cobblestone, each level with its neighbor, providing a smooth ride for passing carriages and horses. The stones were customized by craftsmen, cut to order, rather than simply placed wherever they might fit. A few stately oaks and elms line the sides of the road, shading travelers during the daylight hours.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. [South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent and an open iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, a Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. >[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a cracked marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a rosewood sign, some flaming ruby ashes, a deep fluffy snow drift, and a worn leather money belt are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Zackie the Secian.

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Zackie the Secian.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Zackie through an archway...

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Zackie the Secian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Zackie southwest...

[Market Circle.]

Polished rosewood trim surrounds the door and windows of this tavern. A hand carved relief of intertwined roses adorns the front door, and the words "The Rose Eternal" stand out in gold leaf. Friendly chatter and spirited discussions in all languages can be heard from this famed establishment. Fine food and drink wait just inside.  An open finely carved rosewood door is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Zackie the Secian.
Obvious exits: northeast* east* northwest*.

You follow Zackie through an open finely carved rosewood door...

[Rose Eternal Tavern]

Illumination from the dim oil lamps barely cuts through spilt drink and stale tobacco scented air.  A group of drag-als that seem to have become a permanent fixture here beckons you to join them for a pitcher of ale, and motions to the bartender indicating that you're paying.  Without bothering to acknowledge them, the bartender flashes a toothless grin toward a crowd more likely to have a few coins in their pockets, points them toward a table in the back and offers them an etched wood menu.  An open finely carved rosewood door and a small stage are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Zackie the Secian.
Obvious exits: None.
